Vince decided to go behind Ted’s back and bought out GCW from the Briscoe brothers. This left Turner no choice but to work with McMahon.  For a few weeks, that is. Turns out Vince rushed this whole deal out way too fast and didn’t have any original programming to air on World Championship Wrestling. It was basically just a repeat of his earlier shows aired in syndication that same day. Ratings took a tumble and that gave Turner the excuse he needed to cancel the contract. Vince has held a grudge ever since.

Comment: Harvard actually has a broad range of requirements for its students. For example, all students are required to take Expository Writing and the **few** students who do not do well on an essay exam (given during the first week?) are required to take an extra semester of Intro Writing. So if someone is a genius at math or physics but is not a great writer, they may have to meet this extra requirement. Similarly, students have to fulfill core requirements (they'll get a choice of courses within a subject group like History or Literature or Social Sciences). So it's not very strange to me that they might have an Intro Math course for a few students who are not naturally gifted at Math (and won't really be doing anything academically related to math for their major)- say a world-class musician/writer who never had a talent for math?   It's crazy to me that people are piling on Harvard for this. I actually have a friend who wrote a whole social media rant about it, and I suspect that she is just bitter about not getting into an Ivy League school way back when.
